official-title.#text: To require the exercise of clean-up call options under securities issued by the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation and to prohibit any new mortgage-backed securities issued by such Corporation or the Federal National Mortgage Association from containing provisions for a clean-up call option, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Freddie Mac REMIC Reform Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Subtitle B of title XIII of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1992
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Housing and Community Development Act of 1992/t:XIII/st:B

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: on the mortgage-backed securities issued by the
or, during the term of any conservatorship or receivership of such enterprise pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Housing and Community Development Act of 1992/s:1367

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , shall in the case of any mortgage-backed security with a clean-up call option (as such term is defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Housing and Community Development Act of 1992/s:1369F/ss:d

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , exercise any option under which the residual holder is willing to share not less than 50 percent of any excess proceeds resulting from exercise of such option or right with the Agency as conservator or receiver of such Corporation, if such proceeds benefit the taxpayers of the United States.

text.#text: In complying with any restriction under law, regulation, order, or agreement with the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: from issuing, after the date of the enactment of this section, any mortgage-backed security with a clean-up call option.

header.#text: Prohibition regarding issuance of new securities

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall ensure that any excess proceeds received as a result of the exercise of any clean-up call option shall be used only to reduce the budget deficit of the Federal Government.

header.#text: Use of proceeds To reduce deficit

term.#tail: means debt obligations issued in the form of participation certificates, collateralized mortgage obligations, mortgage-backed commercial paper, and real estate mortgage investment conduits.

means any mortgage-backed security under which there is an option or right to redeem all remaining classes of such security at such time when the amount of the aggregate remaining principal would be less than the amount of the optional redemption or clean-up call percentage, as defined in the applicable offering circular or offering circular supplement.
term.#text: mortgage-backed security with a clean-up call option

header.#text: Mortgage-backed security with a clean-up call option

term.#tail: means, with respect to exercise of any clean-up call option, the excess of the net proceeds from the sale of the collateral underlying the mortgage-backed security with such option, and the redemption price as defined in the applicable offering circular or offering circular supplement.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 3754 IH: Freddie Mac REMIC Reform Act of 2013
